title: J. R. Milton - The Rise of Mechanism: What and Why?
description: At the end of the seventeenth century, corpuscularianism, the mechanical philosophy, and mechanics (as a branch of applied mathematics) were all rising in importance. In this paper, John Milton provides a definitive account of these three concepts, how they relate to each other, and explains why they became popular.
content:encoded: At the end of the seventeenth century, corpuscularianism, the mechanical philosophy, and mechanics (as a branch of applied mathematics) were all rising in importance. In this paper, John Milton provides a definitive account of these three concepts, how they relate to each other, and explains why they became popular.
itunes:subtitle: Professor John Milton (KCL) examines the rise in importance of corpuscularianism in the context of the late seventeenth century
